headline.main: POSTINGS  |  RECENT ENTRIES FROM OUR BLOGS

docs.abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age blog notes study published in Archives of Internal Medicine showing that high blood pressure may indicate better health in the very elderly; Anahad O'Connor Well blog notes study in the Journal of the American Medical Association showing that Type 2 diabetes may be more likely to cause death in normal weight people than their overweight counterparts. keywords.value: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN MEDICAL ASSN

docs.lead_paragraph: Iron, an essential nutrient, has long been the nation's most common nutritional deficiency. In decades past, many parents worried that children who were picky eaters would develop iron-deficiency anemia . My mother boiled meat I refused to eat and fed me the concentrated broth in hopes I'd get some of its iron.Now baby foods, infant formula and many other child-friendly foods, like breakfast cereals, breads, rice and pasta, are fortified with iron. Today iron deficiency is more likely in infants who are exclusively breast-fed, young children who consume too much milk, menstruating and pregnant women, vegans and strict vegetarians , and people who take medications that cause internal bleeding or interfere with iron absorption.

headline.main: Personal Health: A Host of Ills When Iron's Out of Balance

docs.abstract: Jane Brody Personal Health column, examining the dangers of both iron deficiency and overload, offers suggestions for how to balance one's iron intake; addresses dangers of high iron stores in the elderly, which can cause serious health problems. Drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the Olympians competing in London are juiced -- though not in the colloquial sense that someone is doping. Instead, the juice these athletes are imbibing is literal, with beetroot juice and tart cherry juice two of the most popular choices. Growing numbers of elite athletes are turning to these natural beverages to provide what they hope will be a legal performance benefit.Recent studies, however, raise questions about whether the athletes are necessarily receiving the benefits that they think they are and what that means for the rest of us who'd love to find fitness in a glass.

headline.main: Phys Ed: More Athletes Look for an Edge in a Glass of Juice

docs.abstract: Emerging research suggests that consumption of beetroot or tart cherry juice can benefit an athlete's performance and recovery; exercise scientists looking into the potential benefits of the juices caution that much science remains to be done to understand who will benefit and how. Photo (M)

headline.main: A Host of Ills When Iron's Out of Balance
headline.print_headline: Personal Health: A Host of Ills When Iron’s Out of Balance

docs.abstract: Concerns about iron deficiency have eased with the wide availability of iron-fortified foods and drinks. Now more attention is being paid to the opposite problem: iron overload, which can cause serious problems, particularly in older people.
docs.snippet: Concerns about iron deficiency have eased with the wide availability of iron-fortified foods and drinks. Now more attention is being paid to the opposite problem: iron overload, which can cause serious problems, particularly in older people.

docs.lead_paragraph: The study, conducted over three years in 40 states, is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.

headline.seo: Study Links Healthy Weight in Children With Tough Snack Laws
headline.main: Study Links Healthier Weight in Children With Strict Laws on School Snacks
headline.print_headline: Study Links Healthier Weight in Children With Strict Laws on School Snacks

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Pediatrics finds a strong link between lower rates of adolescent obesity and strict laws regulating the sale of snacks and sugary drinks in public schools; conducted over three years in 40 states, study is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.
docs.snippet: The study, conducted over three years in 40 states, is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.
